snippet: Republicans are more fervently pro-Israel than ever, partly a result of ideology, but also a product of a surge in campaign spending on their behalf by a small group of wealthy donors.
abstract: Center for Responsive Politics finds Senate Republicans raised more money in 2014 election cycle in direct campaign contributions from individuals and committees considered pro-Israel than Senate Democrats; trend in part accounts for fervently pro-Israel stance of many Republicans, and could complicate Pres Obama's task of convincing Congress to support proposed agreement with Iran over its nuclear program.
lead_paragraph: Republicans are more fervently pro-Israel than ever, partly a result of ideology, but also a product of a surge in campaign spending on their behalf by a small group of wealthy donors.

headline.main: G.O.P.’s Israel Support Deepens as Political Contributions Shift
headline.print_headline: G.O.P.’s Israel Support Deepens as Political Contributions Shift
